compilations.description: Whether you’re trying to be healthy, pulling an all-nighter, or just trying to get through the day, protein-packed snacks are your best friends. That’s because protein can give you an energy boost and help you stay fuller longer. From avocado deviled eggs to cacao chia pudding, these snacks are full of protein-packed ingredients like Greek yogurt and almond butter, which will ensure you don’t get hangry anytime soon.
compilations.name: Protein-Packed Snacks

compilations.description: Can't sleep? Want to snack? These delicious snacks are a quick and easy fix to all your after-midnight hunger pangs. Chomp down on some hummus and carrot sticks or devour a couple handfuls of delicious oven-roasted chickpeas. And once you're full and satisfied, sail softly back into dreamland!
compilations.name: Healthy Snacks For Late-night Cravings

compilations.description: Planning a trip to the beach to celebrate the coming of summer? These easy snacks will make sure you're fueled and ready for the next game of water polo. From parmesan garlic & herb pita chips to super easy to make banana roll-ups, these treats are beach-friendly and hassle free. So what are you waiting for? Pack up your picnic basket with these goodies: summer's here!
compilations.name: Easy Snacks To Pack For Your Next Beach Trip

compilations.description: Looking for low-carb options? We've got plenty for you! The crispy Chicken Piccata and the saucy Ratatouille Lasagna each pack tons of flavor without going overboard on carbs — and they pair well with just about anything. The hardest part? Choosing which dish to make first!
compilations.name: Low Carb Meals For A Healthy You

compilations.description: You can never go wrong with avocado, and these easy mouthwatering recipes can enjoyed at any time of the day. Start your day with a wholesome Raddish Avocado Toast or enjoy a Salmon Crab Seafood Stack on a lunch date with your special someone. But why settle for one when you have 31 options to try from? Avo-fun for the whole month!
compilations.name: 31 Days 31 Avocado Recipes
Make Healthy Snacks Tasty With These Recipes

compilations.description: We've all had those days when you just don't feel like working out. Regardless of whether or not you make it to the gym, these recipes will keep you feeling engaged, alert, and fueled up for whatever comes your way. From caprese avocado bowls to spinach pasta, these meals are nutritious, delicious, and nourishing.
compilations.name: Recipes For When You Don't Feel Like Working Out

compilations.description: With so many health benefits, you ought to use yogurt wisely and creatively! It is easy to digest, packed with vitamins, and a rich source of protein as well. Make the Honey Granola Yogurt Bark for your on-the-go meals. Paprika-Spiced Chicken With Lemon Yogurt And Crispy Potatoes is the perfect dinner recipe as it is delicious, easy and healthy, all at the same time!
compilations.name: Use Your Yogurt Wisely!

description: This chicken salad is a lunchtime delight! Packed with creamy avocado, tender chicken, and crunchy veggies, it's a healthy and satisfying meal that won't weigh you down. Tossed in a tangy yogurt dressing with a hint of spice, it's a flavor explosion that's perfect for a light meal.

instructions.display_text: In a blender or food processor, combine the yogurt, lime juice, pepper, and chili powder and pulse to combine. Add ½ of the avocado and blend until creamy.
In a medium bowl, combine the chicken, yogurt sauce, celery, the remaining ½ avocado, onion, and salt. Mix until well combined.
Serve on low-carb bread and garnish with cilantro, or as desired.
Enjoy!

keywords: avocado, chia pudding, chicken salad, chickpea chips, deviled eggs, easy, healthy, keto, protein, snacks, vegan, vegetarian
name: Low-Carb Avocado Chicken Salad

compilations.description: Too lazy to cook? These super-quick and easy recipes are perfect for you! From our all time favorite cheesy garlic broccoli to juicy teriyaki chicken, these ideas will delight everyone's taste buds and keep you craving even more. Open up our treasure-trove of recipes and never go hungry ever again!
compilations.name: 3 Ingredient Recipes To Make Your Life Easy

compilations.description: Looking for a fancy meal to cook that doesn't require too much effort? These 3-ingredient, 3-course meal recipe sets are perfect for you. Whether it's a date night or a movie night with friends, cook up these meals in no time and serve to impress everyone. Start with mouth-watering jalapeno poppers and end your meal with a sweet chocolate strawberry braid. We've got something for every taste, no matter what.
compilations.name: 3-Ingredient 3 Course Meal

compilations.description: Having trouble meal-prepping? Not to fear, we've brought you a weekly meal plan for an entire week with just 3 ingredients for each dish. For instance, tuck into a hearty Tomato Avocado Egg Salad for a cozy Sunday at home. Take a glance and let us know which ones are your favorites!
compilations.name: 3 Ingredient Recipes For An Entire Week

compilations.description: Are you famished but too tired to cook? Well, look no further: these super easy recipes will keep all of your hunger pangs at bay. From a delicious two-ingredient chocolate cake to a three-ingredient teriyaki chicken you can whip up these mouthwatering (and fool-proof!) recipes in no time.
compilations.name: No-Fuss Recipes For Those Lazy Days

compilations.description: Chicken is always a crowd favorite, but we you gotta switch it up! Say goodbye to your plain Jane chicken recipes and taste test our carefully picked recipes. If you are a guac fiend like we are, you will absolutely devour the Bacon Guacamole Chicken Bombs and if you're going the fancy route, the Buffalo Chicken Dip is a must-have! Don't forget to pick your favorites!
compilations.name: 30 Ways You've Never Eaten Chicken Before

compilations.description: Everyone's a chicken lover but have you ever tried to challenge yourself with something impressively delicious? We're about to transform you into a masterchef. For a low-lift chicken recipe, try 3-ingredient teriyaki chicken. Then, when you're in the mood for a challenge, try out our mouth-watering crispy creamy chicken cordon bleu. Aprons at the ready – it's cooking time!
compilations.name: Easy To Hard: Chicken Recipes

compilations.description: Just because you haven't had the time to go grocery shopping doesn't mean you can't come up with a tasty and filling meal. Our baked halibut, Cajun BBQ ribs, and teriyaki chicken are absolutely delicious dinners, and best of all, they each require only three ingredients. Oh, how could we forget about dessert? Our hazelnut brownies and creme brulee are just as simple. From our kitchen to yours, you’re welcome.
compilations.name: 3-Ingredient Recipes That Will Change Your Life

compilations.description: Everyone can use a handful of quick, easy meals that fill you right up. From our versatile teriyaki chicken to our easy finger sandwiches, these recipes will keep you satisfied. Open up this treasure trove of recipes and bookmark them for lazy nights.
compilations.name: Easy Recipes That Will Fill You Up

compilations.description: Want to experience the exotic flavors from around the world but too busy to travel? Here's the solution, why not bring the destination to your kitchen! The Japanese culinary export is waiting at your doorstep. Grab your bowls and put on your favorite Ghibli movie because you are invited to bask in the Japanese culinary culture.
compilations.name: Bring Japan To Your Kitchen

compilations.description: You should be taking advantage of these recipes especially when you're pressed for time in the kitchen! With these, you can whip up a divine garlic shrimp scampi within 30 minutes. Want to make a quick lunch for office? Make a healthy thai tofu collard wraps for lunch. Cooking has never been quicker!
compilations.name: Meals In Under 30 Minutes

compilations.description: End the year with a culinary big bang! 2022 is coming to an end, but your nights shouldn't without tasting these delicious recipes. We have got Baked Lobster Tails, Creamy Tuscan Chicken, Korean-Style BBQ Beef, or a 20-Minute One-Pan Pizza to cover all of your cravings. Are you convinced or should we go on?
compilations.name: Tasty Dinners for Every Night of December

compilations.description: Looking for inspiration in the New Year? Get back to basics with Tasty's Top 10 recipes to make in January. Tasty is here to help you savor the flavor and rediscover the joy of cooking—turning each creation into something you will enjoy.
compilations.name: Getting Back to Basics

description: Even though this chicken teriyaki dish uses just three ingredients, the flavor is outstanding, and you can't beat the quick cooking time! This effortless weeknight meal starts with browning pieces of boneless chicken thighs in a hot pan. Soy sauce and brown sugar are added, infusing the meat with the perfect balance of sweet and salty. The liquid sizzles and thickens in the pan into a delectable teriyaki sauce that envelops the chicken, ensuring each bite is packed with flavor. Paired with fluffy white rice, this dish goes from stove to table in 30 minutes, proving that minimal effort can yield maximum satisfaction.

instructions.display_text: Heat a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and sear until golden brown on both sides.
Add the soy sauce and brown sugar and stir to combine, then bring to a boil. Cook until the sauce reduces and coats the chicken.
Serve with rice, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: 3-Ingredient Teriyaki Chicken

components.raw_text: 2 pounds chicken thighs, sliced into chunks

compilations.description: Having trouble deciding what you should make next? Take a look at a few of the best pasta recipes we have to offer! From a vegan version of mac 'n' cheese to delicious baked meatballs and spaghetti, these ideas will satisfy every craving. Pair your pasta with a salad, dessert, and glass of wine — and you've got a restaurant-quality menu right at home!
compilations.name: Tasty's Best Pasta Recipes

compilations.description: Despite so many options, classic penne is always a great choice when it comes to pasta. It’s easy to cook, delicious, and pairs well with almost any sauce. Creamy Chicken Penne Pasta will always satisfy, or try the Fajita Pasta Bake for a creative twist. Add as many or as few veggies as you want and you’re good to go!
compilations.name: Penne For Your Thoughts

description: If you're in need of a hug in a bowl, this creamy chicken penne pasta is just the ticket. With tender chicken, perfectly cooked pasta, and a velvety sauce, it's pure comfort in a bowl.

instructions.display_text: In a deep skillet, fry the bacon until crispy. Remove to a paper towel to drain, then chop.
In the same skillet, add the chicken and season with salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, and paprika. Cook until no longer pink inside.
Add the garlic and cook until softened.
Add spinach and tomatoes and cook until the spinach is wilted.
Add the cream, Parmesan, an red pepper flakes and bring to a boil.
Add the penne and bacon, and stir until fully coated in sauce.
Serve with parsley, Parmesan, and red pepper flakes, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Creamy Chicken Penne Pasta

tips_summary.content:
• Pre-season the chicken for extra flavor 🍗🧂
• Try alternative non-dairy cream and milk options for a lactose-free version 🥛🌱
• Add more cheese for an extra indulgent dish 🧀🤤
• Experiment with different types of pasta for variety 🍝🍲
• Try adding more bacon, mushrooms, tomatoes, or spinach for added flavor and nutrients 🥓🍄🍅🥬

compilations.name: The Only Meal Prep Guide You Need To Follow
Low Calorie Dinners For The Week

compilations.description: Got a hectic day ahead of you and don't have time for a grocery run? We've got your back with our 5-Ingredient Recipes. Bonus? They'll feed you for a whole day. Quell those lunchtime grumbles with our Chicken Pesto & Veggies. Oh, and don't forget to chase that down with a side of Brownies! That's right, you even get dessert. 5-ingredients but full of flavor, these recipes are here for you. Always.
compilations.name: 5 Ingredient Recipes For An Entire Day

compilations.description: Have a really busy week coming up? Well that's no excuse to not eat! We're here to fuel your mind, body, and soul, in the most delicious way possible. Our turkey taco bowl is delicious and will keep you filled up, and our vegetarian grain bowl is an ideal option for vegetarians and vegans. Don't sweat, we've got your back (and your rumbling tummy)!
compilations.name: How To Meal Prep

compilations.description: Mornings are difficult enough without having to prepare lunch for the office. Here are a few quick, easy, and healthy lunch ideas for people who are always on the go. The Weekday Meal-Prep Chicken Burrito Bowls will save you time throughout the week! Make mornings ridiculously simple and nutritious with Microwave Prep Breakfast Sandwiches with ham or bacon.
compilations.name: Easy Office Lunch Ideas!

compilations.description: The new year is upon us and so is the time to make some choices in life. Let’s make a resolution to enter 2023 with healthier habits. From Weekday Meal-Prep Pesto Chicken & Veggies to a Berry Smoothie Bowl, we have got your culinary pact covered.
compilations.name: Healthy Recipes for Your New Year's Resolutions

compilations.description: It's time to celebrate the sun's return to the sign of Aquarius. Use that analytical brain for cooking the tastiest recipes! From Weekday Meal-Prep Pesto Chicken & Veggies to Lemon Bundt Cake, this Aquarius season is going to be delicious for our water bearers!
compilations.name: Recipes for Aquarius Season

description: This pesto chicken and veggies meal prep is a lifesaver for anyone who's looking for a quick and easy way to eat healthy during the week! Tender chicken breasts, green beans and tomatoes are coated in a delicious basil pesto.

instructions.display_text: Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat, then add the chicken thighs. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until the chicken is no longer pink in the center, then remove from the pan. Slice into strips.
Add the green beans to the same pan and cook until tender-crisp.
Return the chicken strips to the pan, then add the tomatoes and pesto. Stir until fully incorporated.
Serve immediately or divide into 4 food storage containers and store in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.
Enjoy!

keywords: chicken, green beans, meal-prep, one-pan, pesto, tomatoes, veggies
name: Weekday Meal-Prep Pesto Chicken & Veggies

compilations.name: Meal Prep Dinners For The Week
4 Meal Prep Chicken Recipes For The Week Ahead

compilations.description: Trying to balance a hectic work schedule with a lean, high protein diet? Meal-prepping for the entire week might be the perfect answer for you. Plan ahead with this easy and tasty Pesto Chicken Pasta. Or, mix it up with some Chicken Teriyaki Stir Fry. You'll save tons of time and feast on some great dishes while you're at it!
compilations.name: Ways You Can Meal Prep Chicken

compilations.description: Have a really busy week coming up? Well that's no excuse to not eat! We're here to fuel your mind, body, and soul, in the most delicious way possible. Our turkey taco bowl is delicious and will keep you filled up, and our vegetarian grain bowl is an ideal option for vegetarians and vegans. Don't sweat, we've got your back (and your rumbling tummy)!

compilations.description: Looking for inspiration in the New Year? Get back to basics with Tasty's Top 10 recipes to make in January. Tasty is here to help you savor the flavor and rediscover the joy of cooking—turning each creation into something you will enjoy.
compilations.name: Getting Back to Basics

description: Weekday meal prep just got easier with this chicken teriyaki stir-fry! It's quick, easy, and full of flavor - the perfect meal to power you through your busy week.

instructions.display_text: In a pan, cook cut chicken over medium-high heat until almost done. Salt and pepper to taste.
Reduce heat to medium and stir in the crushed garlic.
Add in the soy sauce, honey, and 1 tablespoon of the sesame seeds. Stir until thickened.
Remove the chicken from the pan, leaving the sauce, and add the vegetables to the pan.
Cover the pan for several minutes and cook until the vegetables begin to soften, then remove the lid and stir until the sauce is thick again.
Split the rice, vegetables, and chicken evenly between 4 containers. Top with a sprinkle of sesame seeds and sliced green onion. Refrigerate for up to 4 days.
Enjoy!

keywords: bowl, chicken, meal-prep, rice, teriyaki, vegetables
name: Weekday Meal-prep Chicken Teriyaki Stir-fry

compilations.description: We’re all looking for ways to eat a bit healthier and let’s face it: it’s not always easy. But that’s why we’re here to help. These quick and easy dinners under 500 calories promise you explosions of flavor, courtesy of some strong, herbaceous notes and the freshest of ingredients. From a single-pan roasted chicken to a one-pot chickpea curry, we’re here to help you eat healthy, happy, and flavor-laden.
compilations.name: Dinners Under 500 Calories
Kickstart Your New Year With These Low Calorie Meal Recipes

compilations.description: Nothing spells 'sumptuous' like a lip-smaking stir-fry. Our 20-minute beef and broccoli stir-fry is as easy to make as it is to eat. If you're feeling fancy, though, you can try the honey garlic shrimp stir-fry. Need a vegetarian option? Our tofu stir-fry won't disappoint. Get your woks and chopsticks out already!
compilations.name: How To Stir-Fry At Home

compilations.description: The new year is upon us and so is the time to make some choices in life. Let’s make a resolution to enter 2023 with healthier habits. From Weekday Meal-Prep Pesto Chicken & Veggies to a Berry Smoothie Bowl, we have got your culinary pact covered.
compilations.name: Healthy Recipes for Your New Year's Resolutions

compilations.description: Whip up a quick and flavorful meal with these sensational stir-fry recipes! Try the One-Pan Drunken Noodles, packed with bold Thai-inspired flavors, or the One-Pan Chicken and Broccoli Stir-Fry, loaded with tender chicken and crisp broccoli in a savory sauce. This collection is a must-try for busy cooks looking for delicious and easy-to-make meals. Get your wok ready and savor these flavors, perfect for weeknight dinners or a quick and satisfying meal anytime!
compilations.name: Quick & Easy Stir-Fry Recipes

description: This lemon chicken and asparagus stir-fry is a quick and easy weeknight dinner that is full of flavor. The tangy lemon sauce pairs perfectly with the tender chicken and crispy asparagus, making it a healthy and satisfying meal. Serve it over rice or quinoa for a complete meal.

instructions.display_text: Season the chicken with the salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and stir-fry until no longer pink on the outside, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic and continue cooking until the chicken is cooked through, about 4 minutes more.
Add the asparagus, lemon zest, and lemon juice and toss to combine. Cook until the asparagus is tender, about 2 minutes, then stir in the soy sauce.
Serve the stir-fry over rice with more lemon zest on top.
Enjoy!

name: Lemon Chicken And Asparagus Stir-Fry

compilations.description: Planning your next romantic meal at home? This chicken dinner for two will be perfect for it! Start with these four-ingredient bacon green bean twists that are ready in under 30 minutes. Then move on to the star of the show: a super easy garlic brown sugar chicken that’s sure to impress. Then finish strong these ridiculously good triple chocolate tarts. Bon appétit!
compilations.name: Romantic Chicken Dinner for Two

compilations.description: We bet there's nothing more tasty than hearty, delicious, homemade chicken. So we're bringing you the perfect set of chicken recipes to make you forget all about that take-out Chicken Parm. Try our scintillating and then chase it down with the ultimate comfort food: Give these hearty homemade recipes a try and tell us: what's your favorite?
compilations.name: Chicken So Good You'll Forget About Takeout!

compilations.description: You might think that chicken is basic and unexciting, but it's all about how you prepare it. With a few good recipes, it's easy to turn chicken into the most exciting protein. Our mirin-loaded fried chicken and egg rice bowl works for breakfast, lunch or dinner. And this creamy Tuscan chicken tastes just as good as it looks. Thinking of cooking a whole chicken? Go big on the aromatics and make it Hainanese-style. It's the perfect time to spice up your chicken routine.
compilations.name: These Chicken Recipes Are A Total Game Changer

compilations.description: Wanna win everyone's heart at the next family dinner? We've got you covered! Start out with the delicious One-Pot Swedish Meatball Pasta or try the classy One-Pan Teriyaki Salmon Dinner. Impress everyone with your cooking skills!
compilations.name: 5 Dinner Recipes To Impress Your Family!

description: Savor the sweet and savory flavors of this Garlic Brown Sugar Chicken that'll have your taste buds dancing! With a mouthwatering glaze and a hint of garlic, this dish is perfect for a weeknight dinner or a special occasion.

instructions.display_text: Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper.
Heat a cast-iron skillet or pan over medium-high heat, and add the chicken skin side down.
Cook the chicken until it has a dark brown and crispy skin. Flip the chicken and cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 5 more minutes. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
Add the garlic and onion to the remaining chicken fat and cook, stirring frequently until the onions are softened and caramelized.
Add the brown sugar, chicken broth, thyme, and parsley and stir to combine. Bring the sauce to a boil and and cook for 1-2 minutes, until slightly reduced.
Add the chicken back to the pan and coat it in the garlic brown sugar sauce.
Enjoy!

name: Garlic Brown Sugar Chicken

compilations.name: Three-Course New Year's Dinner Party Under 45 Minutes
Romantic Three-Course Dinner You Can Make In 30 Minutes

compilations.description: Looking for low-carb options? We've got plenty for you! The crispy Chicken Piccata and the saucy Ratatouille Lasagna each pack tons of flavor without going overboard on carbs — and they pair well with just about anything. The hardest part? Choosing which dish to make first!
compilations.name: Low Carb Meals For A Healthy You

compilations.description: It's been a long time since you've had a classic getaway that lets you escape the stresses of life. Well, don't worry, you don't need to splurge on a plane ticket just yet – we can bring your ideal Italian adventure to you! Yes, you heard right. Whether you whip up a cheesy, One Pan Pepperoni Pizza or our light and luxurious Zucchini Ravioli, we promise you'll love these Italian delights.
compilations.name: Foods That Will Transport You To Italy

compilations.description: If you know the right way to cook chicken breasts, they can be juicy, tender, and a totally impressive meal. For example, this creamy coconut, spinach, and lemon chicken is so unique you'll want to brag about it to your friends. And for a light yet filling meal, whip up some chicken piccata or juicy chicken marsala. Can you say winner winner, chicken dinner?
compilations.name: Everything You Can Make With Chicken Breast

compilations.description: Chicken is everyone's favorite protein, no really! Luckily, we've got everything you need to celebrate everything chicken has to offer. If you're a first-time cook, you can definitely do justice to these super easy and hearty cozy chicken soup dumplings. Get yourself a whole chicken from the grocery store and cookup a peri-peri chicken feast, paired with some delectable hummus. If you really want to impress, the chicken cordon bleu will have your friends exclaiming 'Ooh, la la'!
compilations.name: Easy To Hard: Chicken Meals

description: Experience the zesty flavors of Italy with this Easy Chicken Piccata recipe that's perfect for a weeknight dinner. Tender chicken breasts are coated in a tangy lemon-caper sauce, making every bite a delightful experience.

instructions.display_text: Butterfly the chicken breast and pound it thin. Salt and pepper to taste.
Dredge each piece in flour, shaking off the excess.
In a skillet over high heat, melt three Tbsp. butter, and brown the chicken, the browner and crispier the better, 3–5 minutes on each side.
Remove chicken from the skillet, and, in the same pan, add chicken stock, lemon, and capers.
Boil until the sauce reduces by ⅓, and return the chicken to the skillet.
Spoon sauce over the chicken several times.
Serve immediately, with the remaining sauce poured over the chicken.
Enjoy!

name: Easy Chicken Piccata

compilations.description: Some chicken dishes can be intimidating to make, especially when you're a beginner at cooking! But what if we told you that you all of these epic chicken dishes come together in just one pan? Our best one-pan chicken recipes will make you feel like a real chef with minimal effort! From delicious Creamy Tuscan Chicken to satisfying One-Pan Garlic Chicken Pesto Pasta, you just can’t go wrong with these one-pan wonders!
compilations.name: 6 One-Pan Chicken Recipes For Beginners

description: This classic dish comes together in just 30 minutes with a handful of pantry staples. The butterflied chicken breast cooks quickly, then is smothered in a creamy and flavorful sauce and served over angel hair pasta. It's the perfect weeknight meal!

instructions.display_text: Butterfly each chicken breast. Lay a piece of parchment paper on top and pound to about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick. Season generously on both sides with salt and pepper.
Cut each breast in half lengthwise so you have 4 pieces of chicken.
Add the flour to a wide, shallow dish. Dredge each piece of chicken in flour, shaking off the excess.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry the chicken until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
Pour the white wine into the pan and cook until reduced by half, about 1 minute.
Add the butter, garlic, and capers and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Stir in the lemon juice and chicken stock and cook for 5 minutes, until the sauce has slightly thickened.
Stir in the cream, then return the chicken to the pan.
Sprinkle with the parsley and turn the chicken to coat in the sauce. Simmer for 2 minutes, until the sauce thickens slightly, then remove from the heat.
Serve the chicken and sauce over angel hair pasta.
Enjoy!

keywords: chicken piccata recipe, classic recipe, cooking, italian, romantic dinner, tasty, tasty_contains_alcohol, weeknight
name: Creamy Chicken Piccata

components.raw_text: Cooked angel hair pasta, for serving

description: This chicken fajita quesadilla is the ultimate mashup of two classic dishes! With tender chicken, colorful peppers and onions, and plenty of cheese, it's a delicious and satisfying meal. Serve it with some salsa and sour cream for an extra kick.

instructions.display_text: In a large skillet, coat chicken with salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin, cayenne, and garlic powder. Cook 5-7 minutes.
Add the peppers and onions and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until they are soft. Remove chicken, onions and peppers from the pan and set aside.
Place the tortilla in the skillet and add a layer of cheese on half of the tortilla.
Add cooked chicken, peppers and onions. Top with more cheese and fold the tortilla in half.
Cook for 6 minutes over medium heat, flipping half way.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with pico de gallo, guacamole, and sour cream on the side.
Enjoy!

keywords: bbq, cheese, cheesesteak, chicken, fajita, mushroom, quesadilla, spinach, steak
name: Chicken Fajita Quesadilla

components.raw_text: ½ pound chicken breast, cut into thin strips

components.extra_comment: green, red, or yellow peppers, julienned
components.raw_text: ½ cup green/red/yellow bell pepper, julienned
1 cup cheddar cheese, shredded (double for 2 quesadillas)
1 cup monterey jack cheese, shredded (double for 2 quesadillas)

compilations.description: If you're looking to eat low carb this week, you're in the right place. We've got recipes that cut the carbs without sacrificing flavor at all. On Mondays, when you just don't have the energy to do anything, test out our energy-boosting Low Carb Egg White Omelet. Feeling a little more indulgent? Give our Low Carb Eggplant Lasagna a shot! Whatever you pick, you can't go wrong.
compilations.name: Low Carb Meals For A Week

description: Kevin Curry of @fitmencook shows us how to make one of his favorite keto-friendly dishes. Sear off chicken thighs and then stir up a creamy sun-dried tomato sauce, all in the same pan! Feel free to customize this recipe to your own liking by swapping out the chicken thighs for chicken breasts or shrimp and using light coconut milk instead of heavy cream.

instructions.display_text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
Season the chicken thighs on both sides with ½ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon black pepper.

Heat a 10-inch cast iron skillet over high heat. Once the skillet is hot, add the olive oil and the chicken thighs.  Cook for 3–4 minutes, or until the edges are seared.  Remove the chicken from the skillet and transfer to a clean plate.
Reduce the heat to medium-low.  Add the garlic thyme, and rosemary to the pan and sauté for 2–3 minutes, until fragrant.

Pour in the chicken stock, then add the sun-dried tomatoes and heavy cream. Season with the remaining ½ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 1–2 minutes, to let the flavors meld, then add the Parmesan cheese and stir until melted.
Return the chicken thighs to the skillet, nestling into the sauce. Drizzle some of the sauce over the chicken.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 15 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
Remove from the oven and let sit for 5 minutes, until cooled slightly and the sauce thickens.
Garnish with the parsley, then serve the chicken over cauliflower rice with more sauce spooned on top.
Enjoy!

keywords: , easy chicken meals, fitmencook, healthy weeknight dinner, kevin curry, leftover chicken recipes, low carb recipes, meal prep cooking, mediterranean chicken and tomato, tasty, tastysinglerecipe, tastystory
name: Low-Carb Mediterranean Chicken And Tomato By Kevin Curry

components.raw_text: ½ teaspoon ground black pepper, divided
⅓ cup chopped sun-dried tomatoes in oil
1 cup heavy cream or full-fat coconut milk
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, for garnish

seo_title: Low-Carb Mediterranean Chicken And Tomato As Made By Kevin Curry

compilations.description: If you're a hopeless ramen-tic, these international noodle recipes are just for you! Travel to Japan with some Tsukemen Dipping Noodles. Make a pit-stop in Europe with our quick and easy One-Pot Swedish Meatball Pasta or a bowl of rustic German potato noodles. You can also slurp away some Chicken and Prawn Pad Thai. Hungry yet?
compilations.name: Noodles Around The World

compilations.description: Chicken is always a crowd favorite, but we you gotta switch it up! Say goodbye to your plain Jane chicken recipes and taste test our carefully picked recipes. If you are a guac fiend like we are, you will absolutely devour the Bacon Guacamole Chicken Bombs and if you're going the fancy route, the Buffalo Chicken Dip is a must-have! Don't forget to pick your favorites!
compilations.name: 30 Ways You've Never Eaten Chicken Before

compilations.description: Work days are feeling long, but we need you to keep powering through, so we think we have just the thing: A whole list of lunches that'll satisfy every mid-day craving. From mouth-watering Chinese-style lemon chicken to vegan pesto pasta, these recipes will definitely make your (work) day.
compilations.name: Tasty's Top 23 Lunches

description: There are many benefits to making your favorite Chinese takeout meal at home — and that includes chicken lo mein! For one, you can add more fresh vegetables to your chicken lo mein, or use soy sauce with less sodium for a lighter version. To make it, all you have to do is stir-fry your chicken and veggies, add cooked egg noodles, and toss it all together with a simple sauce. Top with scallions, box up the leftovers, and you’ll have cheap, yummy eats for days.

instructions.display_text: In a medium bowl, season the chicken with pepper, salt and 1 tablespoon of sesame oil. Mix thoroughly and set aside.
In a separate medium bowl, combine the chicken broth, remaining tablespoon of sesame oil, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and cornstarch. Mix thoroughly and set aside.
Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until no longer pink inside, 3-4 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
Add the garlic and ginger to the pan and cook until fragrant.
Add the mushrooms, onions, carrots, and sugar snap peas. Stir fry until the vegetables are tender.
Return the cooked chicken to the pan and add the cooked egg noodles and reserved sauce. Cook for 3 minutes, until everything is well-coated in the sauce.
Serve garnished with scallions.
Enjoy!

name: Chicken Lo Mein

components.raw_text: 1/2 cup of sugar snap peas, halved

compilations.name: 4 Meal Prep Chicken Recipes For The Week Ahead

compilations.description: Trying to balance a hectic work schedule with a lean, high protein diet? Meal-prepping for the entire week might be the perfect answer for you. Plan ahead with this easy and tasty Pesto Chicken Pasta. Or, mix it up with some Chicken Teriyaki Stir Fry. You'll save tons of time and feast on some great dishes while you're at it!
compilations.name: Ways You Can Meal Prep Chicken

description: Whip up this Meal Prep Pesto Chicken Pasta for a week's worth of delicious lunches! This vibrant, flavorful dish combines tender chicken, al dente pasta, and a homemade basil pesto that'll have you coming back for seconds.

instructions.display_text: Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet. Toss in the asparagus, season with a bit of salt, and sautée until the begin to soften, about 3 minutes.
Pour on the pesto, pasta, and chicken and stir to combine.
Toss in the cherry tomatoes and give everything a stir to combine and warm through.
Distribute pasta mixture evenly between 4 tupperware containers.
Top with parsley for garnish.
Can be refrigerated up to 4 days.
Enjoy!

name: Meal Prep Pesto Chicken Pasta

components.raw_text: 1 pound chicken breast (1 large chicken breast), cooked and diced ($4.01)
2 cups asparagus (10 ounces), cut into 1.5 inch pieces ($3.14)
2 cups whole wheat penne, measured dry ($1.99)

description: This easy and flavorful stir fry is loaded with tender chicken, crunchy cashews, and plenty of veggies. It's the perfect weeknight dinner recipe.

instructions.display_text: In a medium bowl, combine the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, honey, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic. Set aside.
In a medium bowl, season the chicken with salt, pepper, and cornstarch.
Heat a 9.5" fry pan over medium-high heat and add sesame oil.
Add the chicken and cook for 5-6 minutes, or until the chicken begins to brown.
Remove chicken and set aside in a separate bowl.
Add the broccoli and bell peppers, and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add the chicken, cashews and sauce. Stir together and allow sauce to thicken.
Remove from heat and serve over brown rice.
Enjoy!

name: Cashew Chicken Stir-Fry

components.raw_text: ¾ pounds chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces

compilations.name: Shrimp Recipes For True Seafood Lovers

compilations.description: Craving shrimp recipes? We’ve got you covered. But why settle for just one when we’ve curated 30 mouthwatering shrimp recipes to excite your tastebuds? Start with our crowd-pleasing Vegetable and Shrimp Lumpia or try a fancy Hawaiian Garlic Shrimp and Mac Salad. These impressive recipes won't let you down.
compilations.name: 30 Shrimp Recipes

compilations.description: To all the shrimp lovers out there, this is your paradise! Welcome to our delicious shrimp tour, featuring Tasty's most popular shrimp recipes — all handpicked just for you. Try out the fan-favorite creamy spinach shrimp pasta, or spend a day in the kitchen making delicious fried garlic shrimp chips. What are you waiting for? Let's eat!
compilations.name: Delicious Things You Can Do To Shrimp

compilations.description: Who doesn't love pasta? Look forward to every single day of the week with these 7 amazing pasta dishes! You'll keep coming back for more, from creamy Chicken Alfredo to delectable Lemon and Garlic Spaghetti! Satisfy your mid-week cravings with Creamy One-Pot Spinach Shrimp Pasta. Serve up some al dente goodness all week long!
compilations.name: 7 Days, 7 Pasta Dishes

description: Dive into this Creamy One-Pot Spinach Shrimp Pasta that's perfect for busy weeknights! With a delightful blend of succulent shrimp, tender spinach, and a luscious cream sauce, this dish is sure to become a family favorite.

instructions.display_text: In a heated pot, melt butter and olive oil. Add garlic and shrimp, seasoning with salt and pepper.
Cook until shrimp is pink, then put aside.
In the same pot, add milk, broth, and pasta.
Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, so that the pasta does not stick to each other.
Once pasta is al dente, add in spinach, salt, pepper, seasoning, and cheese, and mix until spinach is wilted and everything is coated in the sauce.
Add the shrimp back in and give it a stir until fully incorporated.
Serve with some extra parmesan cheese, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Creamy One-Pot Spinach Shrimp Pasta

description: Say hello to a taste of the bayou with this creamy Cajun pasta! Savory sausage and a bevy of vegetables get a spicy kick with a Cajun-inspired seasoning blend, all tossed in a luscious creamy sauce. Best of all, it all comes together in just one pot for easy prep and clean-up!

instructions.display_text: In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, melt the butter over medium heat until just bubbling. Add the sausage, then season with salt. Brown for 2 minutes on one side, then stir and brown on the other side for 2 minutes more.

Add the onion, season with salt, and cook for 2 minutes, until starting to soften. Add the jalapeño, garlic, and tomato paste. Stir to distribute the tomato paste. Add the Jazzy spice blend and stir to combine.

Add the pasta, red and green peppers, mushrooms, and salt and stir to combine. Pour in the tomatoes and stock. Bring to a gentle boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10-12 minutes, until the pasta is cooked through and the peppers are tender but not mushy.
Mix in the cream cheese to create a thick, creamy sauce.
Serve garnished with scallions, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Creamy Cajun Pasta

components.raw_text: 1 pound spicy Italian sausage links, cut into rounds
1 red bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced
1 green bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced
8 ounces button mushrooms, stemmed and sliced

compilations.description: Chicken is always a crowd favorite, but we you gotta switch it up! Say goodbye to your plain Jane chicken recipes and taste test our carefully picked recipes. If you are a guac fiend like we are, you will absolutely devour the Bacon Guacamole Chicken Bombs and if you're going the fancy route, the Buffalo Chicken Dip is a must-have! Don't forget to pick your favorites!
compilations.name: 30 Ways You've Never Eaten Chicken Before

compilations.description: Ever wondered why Jerry could not keep his hands off the cheese? Cheese is not only "Tasty" but tis' loved by all. Balance your sweet side with something savoury by trying out these cheesy recipes.. and see for yourself why Jerry kept coming back for more.  SAY YES TO CHEESE!
compilations.name: Cheese the Pain Away

compilations.description: Life lesson: Having gone through life, we as humans have learnt one thing, people disappoint. But, pizza NEVER disappoints! So put all your hope and expectations on a double stuffed pan pizza or a hot pizza bagel ! And come out full and satisfied!
compilations.name: People Disappoint, But Pizza Never Does.

compilations.description: These recipes are for those lazy days we all experience. Those days when even moving your finger feels like a chore! Well, we know how you feel, and so we have perfectly curated these easy "lazy" recipes you can make so that you can extend your nap just a little longer! From Hasselback Pizza Chicken to Meatball Sub Bake , we have you covered. So sit back and be lazy. After all, you deserve it!
compilations.name: Recipes to Make When Laziness Kicks In!

compilations.description: Who can resist pizza? We know we can't. A good pizza is the ultimate showstopper. Everyone loves it. There’s no denying that. But we’re taking it up a notch! No more of that plain Jane stuff. Here are some fun pizza recipes that are total game-changers, one for every night of the month! You’ve gotta try our super cheesy Pizza Bombs, our Meatball-Stuffed Crust Pizza Star, or of course, if you’re craving pizza for breakfast (because honestly, same), our Breakfast Pizza Boats!
compilations.name: 30 Fun Pizza Recipes For The Entire Month!

description: Why choose between pizza and chicken when you can have both? This juicy chicken breast is stuffed with mozzarella cheese and topped with pizza sauce, pepperoni, and more cheese. Perfect for a quick and easy weeknight dinner.

instructions.display_text: Cut seven slits on the top of the chicken breast.
In each slit, spread 1 teaspoon of tomato puree, 1 mozzarella slice, and 1 salami slice.
Preheat oven to 350˚F (180˚C).
Sprinkle on the cheddar cheese and oregano.
Bake for 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. It should have an internal temperature of 165˚F (75˚C).
Enjoy!

name: Hasselback Pizza Chicken

tips_summary.content:
• Season the chicken with garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and Italian seasoning for extra flavor 🧄🧅🌶️🌿
• Marinate the chicken for added flavor and tenderness 🍖🧄
• Try using pepperoni instead of salami for a different twist 🍕🍕🍕
• Experiment with different types of cheese like provolone, cheddar, or a pizza blend 🧀🧀🧀
• Consider using pizza sauce, marinara sauce, or spaghetti sauce instead of tomato puree for a saucier experience 🍕🍝🍅

compilations.description: Everyone loves chicken, and these are the best of our recipes! Pick one from the lot, be it either the chicken chow mein or the feta and spinach stuffed chicken pie. These recipes will delight everyone's taste buds and keep you craving even more. So what are you waiting for? Grab your spice box and let's get cookin' shall we?
compilations.name: Tasty's Favorite Chicken Recipes!

compilations.description: Say Ciao to your boring food and Hola to some of the finest Mexican Recipes we have for you here! Start off your meal with these Loaded Chicken Fajita Nachos. Then move on to some Spicy Beef And Pork Empanadas. And nothing screams Mexican than some good old Cauliflower Walnut Burrito. Who's ready for a Mexican Feast?
compilations.name: 6 Mexican Recipes To Make Tonight!

compilations.description: Mexican weddings are more than just a happy time with friends and family to celebrate the couple. They're filled with music, dancing, and loads of food to devour. Check out these dishes you might see at a Mexican wedding reception, from classic Slow Cooker Shredded Chicken Tacos to a classy Shrimp Ceviche! What’s a Mexican wedding without a good slice of Tres Leches Cake to cap off the night?
compilations.name: Big Fat Mexican Wedding!

description: These crispy, golden-brown chimichangas are packed with tender chicken and creamy cheese, making for a decadent and satisfying meal.

instructions.display_text: Add onion, garlic, bell pepper, and jalapeño to a lightly oiled sauté pan. Season with salt and pepper, then cook until onions are translucent.
Once veggies are fully cooked add in chicken, corn, cumin, and paprika. Mix together until fully combined.
Remove chicken from the heat and place in a large mixing bowl.
Add in cream cheese and mix until chicken becomes creamy.
Using a medium-sized ice cream scooper. Scoop out 2 portions of creamy chicken and place on flour tortilla. Top with cheese blend then roll tightly into a burrito.
Preheat oil to 325ºF (170ºC).
Place burrito into shallow oil, flap side down to create a seal and cook for 2-3 minutes on both sides or until golden brown.
Top with sour cream and pico de gallo.
Enjoy!

name: Creamy Chicken Chimichanga

compilations.name: 9 Easy And Delicious Sliders To Serve At Your Next Party

compilations.description: You can never go wrong with sliders! Call your family and friends over and whip up some bbq chicken sliders or make these pork cutlet sliders for an impressive spread. These recipes will be sure to have everyone coming back for seconds.
compilations.name: Slider Recipes For Each Day Of The Week

compilations.description: Our favorite show of the decade has some of the most endearing food moments. Recreate Alexis' smoothie orders from Café Tropical. Make yourself some Enchiladas without having to learn to fold the cheese. Craving some Cinnamon Buns after watching the guests at the motel chow down on them? We've got your back! These recipes will make you feel like you're part of the Schitt's Creek family.
compilations.name: Recipes To Make You Feel Like You're in Schitt's Creek

compilations.description: Can you get more American than a classic slider? Our meaty Sloppy Joe Sliders make for the perfect party snack (or a lazy dinner) and our Pesto Garlic Knot Sliders pack a punch. We also have something for the vegetarians in the group with our Buffalo Chickpea Sliders. Get those buns toasting already!
compilations.name: Let These Sliders 'Slide' Into Your Life

compilations.description: Barbecues are an entire experience in themselves – from the drinks to the grill, they're filled with fun, summer memories that just keep bringing you joy. With these grilled BBQ recipes, that feeling never has to end! A Cheesy Camping Hot Dog will squash your hunger and stir your soul like nothing else. Oh, and don't forget to pair that with a glass of Grilled Lemonade! It sounds strange but it's refreshingly brilliant. Get those grills fired up – it's barbecue time!
compilations.name: Easy Recipes For BBQ season

compilations.description: BBQ season is right around the corner and we’re honestly here for it! This is the perfect time to grill up some incredible dishes and spend the day outside with your friends and family! We’re bringing you some of our favorite finger-licking barbecue recipes to make this cookout your best one yet. From delicious BBQ Chicken Pizza Tacos to a Giant BBQ Rib Sandwich that can feed a whole crowd, these recipes are sure to satisfy!
compilations.name: 7 Easy BBQ Recipes For Your Next Cookout!

description: Make these BBQ chicken sliders, and you will steal the show at any gathering. These delectable mini burgers are filled with cooked shredded chicken and topped with a slather of barbecue sauce and layers of red onion, pepper Jack cheese, and chopped parsley, all nestled between pillowy dinner rolls or sweet Hawaiian rolls. With the convenience of store-bought BBQ sauce and leftover or store-bought rotisserie chicken, whipping up this crowd-pleaser is an absolute breeze. Whether it's a backyard barbecue, an impromptu get-together, or a game day feast, these mini shredded chicken BBQ burgers bursting with incredible flavor will bring yumminess and crowd-pleasing goodness.

instructions.display_text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).

Slice the rolls in half lengthwise. Place the bottom half in a 9 x 13-inch (23 x 33 cm) rimmed baking dish. Spread the chicken evenly over the rolls, followed by the barbecue sauce, red onion, Pepper Jack cheese, and parsley. Top with the remaining rolls.
Brush the tops of the rolls with melted butter. Bake for 20 minutes, until the bread is golden brown. Slice into individual sliders, then serve.
Enjoy!

name: BBQ Chicken Sliders

ingredient.display_plural: dinner rolls or Hawaiian sweet rolls
ingredient.display_singular: dinner rolls or Hawaiian sweet roll
ingredient.name: dinner rolls or Hawaiian sweet rolls

components.raw_text: 12-pack of dinner rolls or Hawaiian sweet rolls

compilations.description: Eating healthy on a budget can be challenging, especially when you don't have time to cook every day. That’s where meal prepping comes in. Set aside an hour for cooking on a Sunday and make yourself cheap and easy meals for the rest of the week. Your future self will thank you! These diet-friendly meal prep recipes are a great place to start, like meat-free portobello fajita bowls and chicken burrito bowls that cost less than $4 per meal.
compilations.name: 5 Easy & Healthy Meal Prep Recipes

compilations.description: Rice is filling. Rice is versatile. Rice is easy to cook. And these rice recipes will have you set for a whole month. Our one-pot Enchilada Rice is cheesy and easy to whip up. For something more fun and cute, try out our beef and broccoli Rice Triangles! If you want to challenge yourself, go all out with the show-stopping Lamb Biryani. Let's face it: with rice, you can never go wrong!
compilations.name: Rice In Everything!

compilations.description: Turn yesterday's rice into today's dinner with these delicious recipes, from chicken teriyaki fried rice to stuffed bean, rice, and chicken burritos to an easy chickpea curry.
compilations.name: So You Made Too Much Rice? We've Got You

description: These hearty burrito bowls are packed with protein and fiber, making them the perfect meal prep option for busy weekdays.

instructions.display_text: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Toss in the onion with a pinch of salt and sauté until the onions have softened, about 3 minutes.

Move the onions to the sides of the pan to create an open space in the middle. Add the cubed chicken into the center of the pan, season with salt and pepper, and sauté until the chicken has cooked almost all the way through.
Add the garlic and mix until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Pour over salsa, black beans, and rice, and mix until everything in the pan is evenly combined.
Let the mixture simmer for 5 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Divide the mixture equally into 4-6 bowls and sprinkle over some thinly sliced green onions.
Enjoy!

name: Meal Prep Chicken Burrito Bowls

components.raw_text: 2 large chicken breasts, boneless and skinless, cubed (1 pound, $6.79)
1 15-ounce can black beans, drained and rinsed ($1.19)
1 cup brown rice, cooked (1 pound bag, $1.79)
Green onions, sliced, for garnish (1 bundle, $0.33)
